title: Understanding Enthalpy Change
text: Enthalpy change at constant pressure can be calculated using the formula: ΔH $$=$$ $$nC_{p\Delta T}$$.

title: Moles and Heat Capacity Relationship
text: In the formula ΔH $$=$$ $$nC_{p\Delta T}$$, the term $$n$$ represents the number of moles, $$C_p$$ is the molar heat capacity at constant pressure, and ΔT is the change in temperature.

title: Find the Change in Temperature
text: Calculate the temperature change by subtracting the initial temperature from the final temperature: ΔT $$=$$ T_{final}-T_{initial}.

title: Calculate \( \Delta T \)
text: Temperature changes from $$298$$ K to $$573$$ K. Calculate ΔT.

title: Molar Heat Capacity for Argon
text: Argon is a monoatomic gas with a molar heat capacity $$C_p$$ of approximately $$20.8$$ $$\frac{J}{mol} K$$ under constant pressure.

title: Calculate the Change in Enthalpy
text: Using $$n$$ $$=$$ $$2.00$$ moles, $$C_p$$ $$=$$ $$20.8$$ $$\frac{J}{mol} K$$, and ΔT $$=$$ $$275$$ K, calculate ΔH in J.

title: Convert Energy to kJ
text: Remember to convert the enthalpy change from Joules to kilojoules by dividing by $$1000$$.

title: Calculate ΔH in kJ
text: Convert joules to kilojoules: $$11344$$ J $$=$$ ? kJ.
